paragraphs.text: This is where the EFF’s HTTPS Everywhere extension comes in handy. It will make sure traffic to non-HTTPS websites is also encrypted. It’s free and you can install it here.

paragraphs.name: a44a
paragraphs.text: If you happen to have a second residence in a county outside the US, you can just tunnel through that home’s network. Otherwise, you’ll need to configure your router to work with one of the VPN services I mentioned earlier.
Most VPNs are services that cost money. But the first VPN option I’m going to tell you about is convenient and completely free.

a5f7494ebb33.title: Isn’t it interesting that a law was needed for the duly elected representatives of The People to…

paragraphs.name: e878
paragraphs.text: Isn’t it interesting that a law was needed for the duly elected representatives of The People to review and override regulations created by the unelected, yet permanent bureaucracy?

f97d174dd603.title: This step will backfire really quick.

paragraphs.name: e360
paragraphs.text: This step will backfire really quick. Moreover it will be GOP backers who are angry about that law. In some way this is good news for privacy promotion. You can override this with vpn easily , and people (at least some of them) will start thinking about privacy, because browsing history was private from the early begging.That would not be the case…

I prefer https://www.privateinternetaccess.com/. There are a whole host of positive benefits using a VPN aside from privacy, like skirting “This video is not available in your country,” and finding cheaper flights. Lots of things are customized to you based on your IP address.

848ea7c67c08.title: Hi Quincy Larson, how does this affect people browsing to US websites from other countries?

paragraphs.name: 2b86
paragraphs.text: Hi Quincy Larson, how does this affect people browsing to US websites from other countries? If I am out of the US, using my local ISP to browse US websites, do US servers routing my traffic fall under this new change of rules, or is it only actual US ISPs who provide internet access to US-based computers who can now collect and distribute this private information?

d8578c2ce9c4.title: If you’re moderately technically skilled, you can get a cheap (or even free) virtual private server…

paragraphs.name: 3fdf
paragraphs.text: If you’re moderately technically skilled, you can get a cheap (or even free) virtual private server in another country and run your own VPN. Then you know exactly what it’s logging. Of course, the VPS company could be spying on your traffic, so be careful who you pick.

ea1974c52332.title: You can use the same VPN service Opera uses (EasyVPN) inside of Chrome, Firefox and other browsers.

paragraphs.text: You can use the same VPN service Opera uses (EasyVPN) inside of Chrome, Firefox and other browsers. Just install the EasyVPN extension, sign up (there’s a free option) and you’re set. No need to install Opera if you don’t want to (or can’t due to app compatibility problems).

95c3d08dc4c5.title: VPNs have a host of benefits beyond privacy.

paragraphs.name: f424
paragraphs.text: VPNs have a host of benefits beyond privacy. If you’re on an open WiFi network like at Starbucks it is essential. But I often worry — how long before the government bans VPNs?

paragraphs.name: 93f2
paragraphs.text: In addition to using a VPN, consider bypassing the ISP monopolists all together. In NYC we have a rapidly growing Mesh Network. We are a community that shares ownership of a network. Collectively we have our own internet connection at our “supernode”.

content.subtitle: HTTPS Everywhere protects you only when you are using encrypted portions of supported web sites. On a supported site, it will automatically…

paragraphs.name: 3a84
paragraphs.text: The HTTPS Everywhere FAQ does not make this claim:

paragraphs.name: 616f
paragraphs.text: HTTPS Everywhere protects you only when you are using encrypted portions of supported web sites. On a supported site, it will automatically activate HTTPS encryption for all known supported parts of the site (for some sites, this might be only a portion of the entire site)…

14ba27ab5a19.title: The cost of VPN service, and of my time to configure and maintain it, is property stolen by…

paragraphs.text: The cost of VPN service, and of my time to configure and maintain it, is property stolen by Congress and the ISP’s who lobby them. Hundreds or thousands of dollars. Let them know in those terms.

97af11aa277d.title: It is so disturbing to keep hearing, oh, it is so easy to set up https on everything, just use…

paragraphs.name: 254e
paragraphs.text: It is so disturbing to keep hearing, oh, it is so easy to set up https on everything, just use GoEncrypt, it’s free. Well, most web hosts don’t support GoEncrypt, I imagine because they’d lose money from selling their own over-priced SSL certificates. I can’t just move all 20 of my websites to another ISP so easily. Please help those of us whose ISP…

9b5ecfe9f5c.title: Trusting in Centralized VPN is the same as giving keys to your information from ISP to VPN provider…

paragraphs.name: 1f69
paragraphs.text:
Trusting in Centralized VPN is the same as giving keys to your information from ISP to VPN provider :) makes it a lot easier “highest bidder” to collect their harvest from fewer providers ..
If this is all we’ve got, then it looks like a gloomy future, yet there are initiatives which might just try to solve this issue — how about an Opensource and…
